column1: # Format of a PUP scene line:

column2: W - Switch
1 - interruptable by frame match or PUP trigger
replacing triggering frame
1 - loop
>= 2 - create x frame groups (you get x times the number of frames entered in 2 to play changing scenes)
1 - play random frame group
>= 1 - start this scene after x seconds of inactivity (no new frames)
column4: could be combined with frame groups

column2: show last frame of the scene until a new frame is matched
column4: 2 - show last frame before scene started

column1: # Postions 4 - 10 are optional. If not provided
column2: the default is 0.
interruptable
interruptable
interruptable

column1: # This will generate 3 groups of 75 frames
column2: so 225 frames in total.

column1: # Every time the PUP ID 63511 get triggered
column2: only one of the three groups gets played (75 frames).

column1: # First occurrence of the PUP ID will play group 1
column2: the second group 2. After the third group
column3: it will start again with group 1.

column1: # This will generate 4 groups of 200 frames
column2: so 800 frames in total.

column1: # If no frame is matched for 5 seconds
column2: randomly one of the 4 groups gets played once.

column1: # When the 100 frames of the scene ended
column2: the previous original frame will be shown.

column1: # The internal timer gets reseted and after 5 more seconds of inactivity
column2: another group of 100 frames gets randomly played

column1: # This way an attract mode for early electronic games with segment displays can be implemented.

column2: the last scores are shown until someone starts a new game.

column1: # Now the scores are displayed for 5 seconds
column2: than a random short video scene out of four gets played for 4 seconds.

column1: # Then the scores are shown again and so on until someone starts a game.
